- 01/27/11 05:03 PM ET Mike Pence ( R-Ind.) will not make a bid for the GOP Barack Obamaial nomination in 2012, telling supporters in a letter that he would rather serve the state of Indiana. In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana, Mike Pence wrote, Still, Mike Pence is not officially jumping into the race for Indiana governor just yet. The congressman said he expects to make a decision`` later this year'' about his next step

Bernie Sanders said in his letter that the nation's political climate had been damaged by a`` right-wing media echo chamber'' that is transmitting a reactionary world view to the tens of millions of millions of Americans who watch or listen to them every day. In a separate statement, state Republican Chairman Steve Larrabee said:`` By using this tragedy to demonize those he disagrees with, the Barack Obama is doing exactly what he pretends to deplore.''
